website_summaries.verdict: Colorful cubes that snap together and pop apart to give your child hands-on math practice.
pros: Kit includes 115 multi-colored mathlink activity cubes plus activity cards that teach sequencing, addition, subtraction, and many other skills
Cubes can be used for math and building skills long after your child masters the included activities
cons: The cubes may be challenging for some children to pop together and take apart

customer_reviews.title: the worst product i bought from Learning Resources
customer_reviews.text: The cubes are too tight for little kids, making ti impossible to play and learn with them. What's the point of the cubes if my child can't even assemble them. The worst product i ever bought from Learning Resources, save your money and check some other of alternatives
customer_reviews.author: Narmina

customer_reviews.title: not as good as the Learning Resources Mathlink Cubes
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as the Learning Resources Mathlink Cubes, Homeschool, Educational Counting Toy, Math Cubes, Early Math Skills, Math Manipulatives, Set of 100 Cubes, Ages 5+ I originally bought the set above and it was wonderful. Sturdy, snapped together wonderfully, did its job right? I just ordered the Mathlink Builders, TOTALLY different plastic. The linking blocks aren't sturdy, they swivel when you stack them, you can't push them together with ease (6 and 7yos) and they are slightly bigger. The last thing I need for learning is the kids getting frustrated and being "done." I did not expect them to be this way. Items can be used, but with help and not independently anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa-s

customer_reviews.title: good idea but a bit tight for little hands
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of the design. Smart thinking to provide visual of addtion and subtraction. However, the cubes are a bit too tight for little hands to seperate them, at least in the case of my 3-yr old son.
customer_reviews.author: LIN

customer_reviews.title: Great for education and imagination
customer_reviews.text: We received this product as a Learning Resources Brilliant Minds member. My kids (7 and 5) loved using the idea booklet that came in the box to build several things, then started using their imagination to build other items, like their names. I can see how these would be great in helping to learn math, counting, sorting, etc. The only negative was how hard they snapped together and came apart at times. The kids tended to need help. Hoping they get easier with use.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina B

customer_reviews.title: Fun educational toy
customer_reviews.text: I expected these blocks to be more like base ten, and I am sure you could use them that way. But they come with directions to create fun things like a giraffe or a key. My girls enjoyed building their own things too like the letters in my photo. They are unique because you could make the objects three-dimensional but my 7 year old and 5 year old have not figured that out yet. These are high quality and built to last, we are going to use them for play and in our homeschool math!
customer_reviews.author: Scott&Wife

customer_reviews.title: Must be STRONG!
customer_reviews.text: My almost 6 yr old was so excited to get these...and then so sad because she can barely put them together. They are even hard for an adult to snap together! Don't buy unless your child has the hand strength of Godzilla
customer_reviews.author: Kylee

customer_reviews.title: Kids Love These!
customer_reviews.text: These counting blocks and worksheets are perfect for working with kindergarteners with counting by 1's , 5's, and 10's and helps them grasp the concept of seeing what quantity looks like vs just recital of the numbers. The colors are vibrant, making it even more fun, and in groups they can pick their favorite. They are strong and durable and easy enough for them to connect and pull apart with little hands. The Package came in great condition, is of good quality and is great for storing if you decide to keep them inside of it.
customer_reviews.author: cyntsational

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool for PreK children and up
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great learning tool for my son who is currently in preschool. There are 100 blocks in the set. They can be used for counting, learning colors, and learning basic math. I expect these can be used for several years as a way to learn basic multiplication and division as well. The blocks are a little bit hard for young kid to put together, they learn as they continue to play with them. The learning cards that come with the set are a good for showing various ways the blocks can be used.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Johnstone

customer_reviews.title: Endless Learning Possibilities
customer_reviews.text: These cubes have so many possibilities in the classroom and at home. They are perfect for one to one counting, base ten activities, ten frame modeling, skip counting, and more! Also, there are fun problem solving challenges for the kids to make STEM connections. Kids can also just enjoy building with them, so they are really a versatile learning tool! I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: J. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Great for pre kindergarten children
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would love this product. The learning programs in it are very limited. It almost seems like they tried to put too much into it so you have a little bit of everything. So it makes it very limited to learn with. You can buy the blocks separately and just use those to help your child learn with other products. For a math introduction and ideas it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Jose and Pa-ti

customer_reviews.title: Tough to put together and pull apart
customer_reviews.text: This is a good idea, but not well executed. The pieces are tough for me to connect and pull apart (further more for my toddler). The cards are good, but because the pieces are so tough to push together and disconnect playing isn’t fun. I would not recommend this product unless you have your own blocks.
customer_reviews.author: CMU

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I agree with what others say about the cubes being hard to put together for little hands but I am very pleased with the quality of the product. You can use them for multiple math skills. Counting with 1:1 correspondence, sorting, matching number to value, patterns, block designs, concepts like more/less, bigger/smaller, etc. Overall very pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer Jen

customer_reviews.title: Could be better still worth getting
customer_reviews.text: I thought the cubes were bugger in size. One of the pieces was damaged from the manufacturer I believe. See the picture. Its a little hard to link the cubes. I wish they would link more easily so that my younger toddler can use it as well. The plastic doesnt seem as durable as I thought. Time will tell. Still a good purchase for the price I paid about 10 something. Its a really good math manipulative and good to practice gross motor skills.
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: Love the templates but not the blocks.
customer_reviews.text: Love the templates for learning because you are able to use dry-erase markers for it but the blocks itself are very hard to connect and take apart. I say this because I have purchased previous blocks that are easy to connect and remove.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy lopez

customer_reviews.title: Durable, but Difficult
customer_reviews.text: Unless you have titanium fingers these little blocks are ridiculously difficult to snap apart and connect together. Third graders struggled to enjoy building with these, and made more use with their half broken “snap cubes” (we meant to replace with these new ones). There only saving grace is that once they are connected they sure are staying that way! They are sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: DASH2017

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to break apart
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic quality. But I can barely pull them apart, let alone my child. I don't know if I should return them or spend hours shaving the holes down to avoid buying bad quality ones.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 4 year old. She really enjoys it and I am happy with what she is learning. There are also lots of free cube activities available online that I have been able to use these cubes with. It's a great tool to help little ones with math and great for homeschooling as well.
customer_reviews.author: Val & Lora

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Great quality. Regret not buying multiple. MUST HAVE FOR JOME SCHOOLING
customer_reviews.text: It arrived right on time almost the next day. It was packaged great. Highly recommend and WILL BE BUYING AGAIN. Don’t waste anymore time looking especially these times on homeschooling for 2020. Break product and great quality the activities were GREAT and super educational
customer_reviews.author: francine lopez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Quality!
customer_reviews.text: thank you for this product, the cubes are amazingly made. I just would like to buy more cubes without needing to buy the cards. the cards are great too but I just needed 1 set of those. The boys like to make games and mazes with the cubes and just explore with their imagination but not enough cubes. The kit is a very nice starter kit. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Evey

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping.
customer_reviews.text: My 3 years old son loves it so much. I was concerned about other's review.They said its hard to snap.My 3 years old son can snap it with ease.He barely needs my help though. Better than unifix i would say-the looks and quality.I highly recommend for toddlers .
customer_reviews.author: EMS

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to snap together or pull part single connections
customer_reviews.text: These serve their purpose, but my five year old struggles to snap them together. It’s hard for me to snap them together. You have to have some good hand strength to push the connector in. If you’re trying to make a long sequence they often pop apart because of how hard you have to push on them to snap them. They aren’t any easier to pull apart one at a time. I am hoping they will loosen up after some time, but so far no change. I think I’m hindsight I would have gone with something simpler or not connectable.
customer_reviews.author: Barton Hudson

customer_reviews.title: perfect for remote learning
customer_reviews.text: This is what we need to enhance remote learning and my youngest preschool son is picking up on so much as well! Highly recommend. I love the box is sturdy to put these cubes away and the learning cards are so helpful.
customer_reviews.author: JMS

customer_reviews.title: Great addition for the young learner
customer_reviews.text: We've only had these a few days but I must say that they've greatly improved my child's understanding of place value and overall addition and subtraction. We love the colors and the way they stay stuck. There are awesome games as well. These are a great addition for your young learner
customer_reviews.author: Verotechno

customer_reviews.title: Numberblock play
customer_reviews.text: My 4 and 6 year olds love the show Numberblocks, and these are unbelievably perfect for their imaginations and growth. They play with them more than I would have guessed because they imagine them as the characters from the show. One of my best buys yet! My 4yo has a little trouble clicking them together, but my 6yo does just fine with them. And I love how they came with game/learning activities and suggestions. I'm just sorry I didn't purchase sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: A true quality STEM activity
customer_reviews.text: My children love these blocks! They try to build many different 3D items and also can try to copy the ideas that came with the blocks. They are built strong and do not break when dropped. I would recommend these for a good educational game that helps your child be creative!
customer_reviews.author: mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Love this for my 4 yr old!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase! My 4 yr old has asked to play with these every day since we gave them to him. My 2 year old likes them too but gets frustrated easily with them because they're just hard for a 2 yr old to put together. Regardless I'm so glad I purchased these.
customer_reviews.author: EMini

customer_reviews.title: Good but difficult to connect.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty difficult for my child to put together...for now will continue to use legos for math. I remember using those in school so perhaps when my child is older they will be easier to snap together (but a little difficult for me as well).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useful for math from Pre-K to 5th grade
customer_reviews.text: It engages my 1st grader in learning math. It gives kids a tactile and spatial means to understand math concepts. I purchased it to learn counting and addition and subtraction and was happy to learn the it can be used for so much more from pattern recognition, area, and volume concepts to multiplication and division. It is something useful for all of elementary school.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Great learning toy
customer_reviews.text: My kids loved this set! They are ages 6 and 3.5 and the set comes with different cards to work on different age leveled skills like patterns and addition. They can both play with it without my assistance and ate getting great practice
customer_reviews.author: Lizbeth Marin

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgic and son loves them
customer_reviews.text: Just like the ones when I was a kid! The feel and sound of them hitting the table is nostalgic. Bought these for my son to help with addition and subtraction and he loves them. They do feel a little tough to snap in (not like I remember) but it doesn’t seem to phase my 6 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: amazing toy
customer_reviews.text: They are like the "Numberblocks". Great for learnig math and volumen relations amog objects. Create from robot to analog tetris. Really fun and educative
customer_reviews.author: Mary ALL

customer_reviews.title: Great to help with number bond problems
customer_reviews.text: The only way to help my daughter with her number bonds when they don’t provide a visual aid on her worksheets
customer_reviews.author: serena shaw

customer_reviews.title: great for homeschooling, great for Math U see
customer_reviews.text: Perfect addition to our Math curriculum as extra blocks for our littles. Great activity cards that come with it!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Hands on Math
customer_reviews.text: What else can I say except that kids need hands-on and visual tools to access math and this delivers. Perfect for kids ages 3-7.
customer_reviews.author: #1Docmom

customer_reviews.title: Great, but can be tough to snap together
customer_reviews.text: These are great, but they can be hard for 4 year old hands to put together. They require quite a bit of pushing. There was definitely some frustration at first! But my daughter is loving them, and it looks like she will for quite some time. There's a great variety of activity cards included.
customer_reviews.author: E. Greene

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful educational tool
customer_reviews.text: Grandchild loves this she plays with them every time she watch number cube cartoon great learning tool she makes them in the shapes of different numbers for counting and learning adding and subtracting
customer_reviews.author: lauri Arn

customer_reviews.title: Colorful blocks
customer_reviews.text: I like these blocks with rainbow colors, but some edges are not smoothly cut. Be careful when little kids are using them.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Loves them
customer_reviews.text: My son loves them. After doing some learning with them, we made a helicopter, laser, a minecraft toy...etc. He loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie Soria

customer_reviews.title: Positive
customer_reviews.text: Item exactly as described. Perfect for kids learning tool. Quick and timely shipping
customer_reviews.author: agra7

customer_reviews.title: Great blocks
customer_reviews.text: These blocks snap together and apart very easily. They are very easy for my 5 year olds to use on his own. Colors are bright and vibrant.
customer_reviews.author: Kyra Mills

customer_reviews.title: Playful
customer_reviews.text: My kids are really love playing, you can create all sorts of games/ways to play with it.
customer_reviews.author: yongfei

customer_reviews.title: Happy with quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for online learning and my kids love using them. Definitely worth the buy to teach tens and ones
customer_reviews.author: RNC

customer_reviews.title: Learning is fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 5-year-old son actually plays independently with these!! He makes the Number Block characters and adds groups of blocks on his own! However, his twin sister isn’t so excited about them. Ha!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: So hard to connect or get apart. Built structures are not sturdy enough to play with. The ones at school are more fun, the kids say.
customer_reviews.author: A. R.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for 4 year old boy!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old is loving these! Great product, lots of imaginative building play, and great way to help with preschool at home :-)
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Hart

customer_reviews.title: Good product and visual aid to teach math
customer_reviews.text: Product was very easy for my 4 year old to put together and take apart. The cards weren't quite as useful as I had hoped, but my kids still seemed to enjoy it. Product is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: Great for homeschool math
customer_reviews.text: Love that this set comes with cards. Great for homeschool math and STEM
customer_reviews.author: LindseyLee&Co.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to connect
customer_reviews.text: Love all the colors and the endless possibilities of building. I did not like that it is very difficult for a 5 year old to connect them together.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy of two 0207

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Mathlink Builders to add to our STEM bins for our homeschooling daughter who is 5 years old. They were easy to use, soft edges for little hands and great quality. I like to suggest that more creativity cards be added to the set. Other than that, I recommend the product. ♥
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Adds excitement to learning math
customer_reviews.text: My son has ASD & is absolutely in love with these. I was unable to get him to sit & learn anything with numbers until I found these. He loves the colors, the way they snap together, & the patterns on each block. I am glad I spent the money on these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not well made, disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am a mother of a 3 year old. This is a great teaching tool for early math. I give it a 2 stars because the cubes are made poorly. They're too tight, and some cubes do not fit well. Even for an adult, is not easy to snap on and off. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: FM Cheung

customer_reviews.title: A must have.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1st grater and a 4 year old. This is a must in school.
customer_reviews.author: NF

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Work as expected. My 4 yr old plays with then without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: krish

customer_reviews.title: Math blocks
customer_reviews.text: Perfect!! Bought these to my 4 year old grandson. Amazed with how easy it was/is for him to learn adding, subtracting. He loves them and when wants to know amount will pull these out! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bright colors!
customer_reviews.text: Vibrant colors. Durable. Can be difficult for little hands to get to snap back together. Comes with a few ideas for patterns. With 4 kids, we could use multiple sets in our house! I reviewed this product for free from learning resources and brilliant minds member.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Kreider

customer_reviews.title: Too too tight and hurt my kid fingers
customer_reviews.text: This product is too tight to make it . Even though my kid is 5 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Cherry jiang

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to snap together but otherwise great
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because I didn’t know I’d be homeschooling my daughter... They’re the perfect size and brightly colored. The only con is they’re incredibly difficult to snap together and take apart for her and sometimes for me.
customer_reviews.author: noe v

customer_reviews.title: My son loves them
customer_reviews.text: So colorful so fun he really enjoys working with them when I start math
customer_reviews.author: Nada s.

customer_reviews.title: Great motoric skill to learn math
customer_reviews.text: Great tools to learn math....especially for young kids, very attractive.... But some of color, i think the blue and pink... it really hard to open and put back together, me and my kids are having a hard time to play with the blue and pink
customer_reviews.author: Tesalivika Ernawan

customer_reviews.title: Like another brand better
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t stick together as well as another brand. Has more of a shiny texture than matte.
customer_reviews.author: Krystle Zoller

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: It helped that these blocks could be connected in a variety of ways... not all snap cubes are like this
customer_reviews.author: Georgina Levey

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My kids love these so much! Check out numberblocks on YouTube my kids are learning math so quickly at age 3 and 5 because of these and that show.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Smith

customer_reviews.title: Math cubes
customer_reviews.text: These are great but tough for my 7yo to pull apart. Can be tricky to snap together as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lara's

customer_reviews.title: Helps with visual learning
customer_reviews.text: I love this! It has helped with this forced homeschooling. Im a visual learner, so I'm visually teaching my daughter, it has helped a lot! A very well investment ❤
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Barragan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for learning. My 3 year old cant snap the, together yet, but they’re wonderful for learning. The learning cards are a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: Leah G Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Great versitile blocks
customer_reviews.text: We love these! Theyre a great teaching tool plus just a fun snap together building toy, comes with a small book of ideas for building & learning
customer_reviews.author: Mommy6209

customer_reviews.title: Great for math
customer_reviews.text: My son's favorite subject is math so he loves the blocks
customer_reviews.author: LaToya

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: It was what I was looking for. The cards could be better. I wish they sold one color packs also. For example all white.
customer_reviews.author: Dilenia Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old uses these to learn to add and subtract. He loves these blocks so much. They are colorful and great for learning.
customer_reviews.author: #momof5boys

customer_reviews.title: Can’t be snapped back
customer_reviews.text: They are extremely hard to be snapped back for my 5 year old son. It’s discouraging for him to play by himself. They are so tight to be snapped that they hurts my son’s figures everytime playing them. Huge disappointment and I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: edith

customer_reviews.title: Great set!
customer_reviews.text: Great little set for my daughters. The laminated cards are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: morty perez

customer_reviews.title: It was too hard to use these cubes
customer_reviews.text: Almost impossible to use these cubes, even for adults. These cubes do not link. We returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it ....good for playing with him for all the math related subject...even can work as a block...great value
customer_reviews.author: Ray Hsu

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money - so hard to snap!
customer_reviews.text: Should have listened to over reviews! Almost impossible for my 5 and 7 year old to snap together. What a waste. They got frustrated with quickly and now they’ll just collect dust now.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda K

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to connect
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my preschool room. The pieces are challenging for me to connect together let alone a 4 year old. I should have bought traditional unifix cubes.
customer_reviews.author: Lgola

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! My son attends Montessori and uses these there. Due to COVID, I have been homeschooling the Montessori way. These are exactly the same as the ones he used at Montessori.
customer_reviews.author: Latasha Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Fun and educational!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect toy that is fun and educational at the same time. Mathkink Cubes exposes kids to math concept in a fun and intuitive ways. Our 4 year old son loves it so much. He is able to concentrate and play With it for a long time, which is rare.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Chan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for math - kindergarten
customer_reviews.text: Great cubes for kindergarten math for counting collections. Makes it interesting for my 5 year old.

customer_reviews.title: they do not stay in place.
customer_reviews.text: Too many shapes to lock and pieces do not stay locked into place. They basically spin and or fall out.

customer_reviews.text: Hard to put back together but the kids still like them.

customer_reviews.title: What a HIT
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 5 yo Grandson in Switzerland for his Birthday !! His Mom reported that he started playing with them instantly!

customer_reviews.title: Good Excercise  but the cubes are too tight for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: Good exercise for the kids but the cubes are too tight and need parent assistance

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Six year old is using it to help with math. He loves them!

customer_reviews.title: Perfect purchase. Totally happy!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 4 year old who’s currently peaking in numbers. He uses them himself 80% of the time. He’s creative with them. Really a fun way to learn.

customer_reviews.title: Must buy!
customer_reviews.text: Kids love them! Pair these with Number Blocks episodes and watch them learn to count!

customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my 5 year old. The pieces require more hand strength than a child that age has.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!

customer_reviews.title: Loved this product

customer_reviews.text: My 4yr and 3yr old really love this. Great way to teach them to count.

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for a kid learning basic math
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my 5 yo son who loves numblerblocks on YouTube. He loves this toy and kept him entertained for house during a long drive.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: This work just like the ones my kids have in school. They’re perfect for playing around with and using for math practice.

product_meta.title: Learning Resources Early Math MathLink Cube Activity Set, Math Cubes, Early Math Skills, 115 Pieces, Ages 4+
product_meta.description: Add even more fun to your splash-filled adventures! With the Sand & Water Fine Motor Set from Learning Resources, kids discover four new ways to learn in the sand and surf. This set of four toddler-sized tools includes a squeezy bottle, spinner, wavy dropper, and scooper, each of which demonstrates a different physical concept through fun, easy-to-understand interactive play. Made of durable plastic, these tools are tough enough to accompany kids wherever water is found—add even more interactive fun to water and texture tables, bring learning into the bath, or combine them with the buckets and shovels of your existing beach kits for a fun twist on the traditional sand castle. In addition to adding fun to outings and activities, the Sand & Water Fine Motor Set also helps kids build the fine motor skills and hand muscle strength they need as part of school readiness checklists. Ages 3+.
feature_bullets: EARLY MATH SKILLS: Teach addition and subtraction in a tactile way with these MathLink Cubes!
